Posts.Content: Hi every1 had large solid lump for 5 wks now ongoing pain in ribs n chest never had problems before had mammo result r3 and fine needle c3 but benign core biopsy my lump is over 5cm I'm 38 coming up n consultant won't remove it X he says it's a fibrodenoma but I don't think my symptoms match up I also have nipple changes in that breast I want it removed as it's very uncomfortable any ideas anyone ?
Posts.Title: Different biopsy results

Posts.Content: On Apr 09, 2016 8:08 PM Voiceofreason wrote: A fibroadenoma is normally a long standing tumour with little change to it but it may become more noticeable due to various reasons.  Most FAs are diagnosed on simple FNA and a core biopsy should confirm this but 5 cms seems pretty large and I would wonder why your clinician would still not want the lump removed.  Excisional biopsy recommendations are commonly made anyways, especially for those whose age starts putting some lesions into a grey area.  If it is causing you some issues physically or emotionally, then I think it would reasonable for your clinician to excise the lump and confirm it was nothing more than a benign FA.He has referred me to another surgeon for 2nd opinion on removal he says its fibrocystic disease it's been nearly six weeks now n it hasn't gone down I wud just like it took away 4 peice of mind also fed up of been sore all the time
